tool.name: Create initial files: topology and GRO structure file.
tool.command: ln -s '$pdb_input' ./pdb_input.pdb && gmx pdb2gmx -f ./pdb_input.pdb -o processed.gro -p topol.top -i posres.itp -water $h2o -ff $ff -${ignore_h}ignh &>> verbose.txt && gmx editconf -f processed.gro -o newbox.gro -c -d $box_d -bt $box_type &>> verbose.txt

param.label: Box type
param.help: triclinic is a triclinic box, cubic is a rectangular box with all sides equal dodecahedron represents a rhombic dodecahedron and octahedron is a truncated octahedron. The last two are special cases of a triclinic box. The length of the three box vectors of the truncated octahedron is the shortest distance between two opposite hexagons. Relative to a cubic box with some periodic image distance, the volume of a dodecahedron with this same periodic distance is 0.71 times that of the cube, and that of a truncated octahedron is 0.77 times.
param.option: Rectangular box with all sides equal (cubic)

param.name: capture_log
param.label: Generate Detailed Log
param.help: Generate detailed log information that can be summarized with ParseLog.

tool.help:
GROMACS is a versatile package to perform molecular dynamics, i.e. simulate the Newtonian equations of motion for systems with hundreds to millions of particles.
It is primarily designed for biochemical molecules like proteins, lipids and nucleic acids that have a lot of complicated bonded interactions, but since GROMACS is extremely fast at calculating the nonbonded interactions (that usually dominate simulations) many groups are also using it for research on non-biological systems, e.g. polymers.
